summary.para: The GetCaps method retrieves the capabilities of the underlying hardware.

param.name: pPin
param.para: Pointer to the pin to query capabilities from.

param.name: pCapsFlags
param.para: Pointer to a value representing a combination of the flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: Possible capabilities include one or more of the following: flipping the picture horizontally, flipping the picture vertically, enabling external triggers, and simulating external triggers.

summary.para: The GetCurrentActualFrameRate method retrieves the actual frame rate, expressed as a frame duration in 100-nanosecond units. USB (Universal Serial Bus) and IEEE 1394 cameras may provide lower frame rates than requested because of bandwidth availability. This is only available during video streaming.

param.name: pPin
param.para: Pointer to the pin to retrieve the frame rate from.

param.name: ActualFrameRate
param.para: Pointer to the frame rate in frame duration in 100-nanosecond units.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: The GetFrameRateList method retrieves a list of available frame rates.

param.name: pPin
param.para: Pointer to the pin to query for the list of frame rates.

param.name: iIndex
param.para: Index of the format to query for frame rates. This index corresponds to the order in which formats are enumerated by structures returned by ) minus one.

param.name: Dimensions
param.para: Frame image size (width and height) in pixels.

param.name: ListSize
param.para: Pointer to the number of elements in the list of frame rates.

param.name: FrameRates
param.para: Address of a pointer to an array of frame rates in 100-nanosecond units. Can be NULL if you only need ListSize.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: The caller is responsible for freeing the memory through a call to CoTaskMemFree.

summary.para: The GetMaxAvailableFrameRate method retrieves the maximum frame rate currently available, based on bus bandwidth usage for connections, such as USB and IEEE 1394, where the maximum frame rate may be limited by bandwidth availability.

param.name: pPin
param.para: Pointer to the pin to retrieve the maximum frame rate from.

param.name: iIndex
param.para: Index of the format to query for maximum frame rate. This index corresponds to the order in which formats are enumerated by . The value must range between zero and the number of supported VIDEO_STREAM_CONFIG_CAPS structures returned by ) minus one.

param.name: Dimensions
param.para: Frame image size (width and height) in pixels.

param.name: MaxAvailableFrameRate
param.para: Pointer to the maximum available frame rate. The frame rate is expressed as frame duration in 100-nanosecond units.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: The GetMode method retrieves the video control mode of operation.

param.name: pPin
param.para: Pointer to the pin to retrieve the video control mode from.

param.name: Mode
param.para: Pointer to a value representing a combination of the flags from the enumeration, which specify the video control mode.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: Possible modes of operation include one or more of the following: flipping the picture horizontally, flipping the picture vertically, enabling external triggers, and simulating external triggers.

summary.para: The SetMode method sets the video control mode of operation.

param.name: pPin
param.para: Pointer to the pin to set the video control mode on.

param.name: Mode
param.para: Value specifying a combination of the flags from the enumeration to set the video control mode.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: Possible modes of operation include one or more of the following: flipping the picture horizontally, flipping the picture vertically, enabling external triggers, and simulating external triggers.

summary.para: The IAMVideoControl interface controls certain video capture operations such as enumerating available frame rates and image orientation.

remarks.para: For Windows Driver Model (WDM) devices, the WDM Video Capture Filter automatically exposes this interface if the WDM driver supports the PROPSETID_VIDCAP_VIDEOCONTROL property set. For more information, see the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) documentation.
